payload.text:
**Analyzing Tailwind dark mode issues**

I'm thinking the dark mode problem might come from Tailwind's `darkMode` config not set to `"class"`, causing `dark:` variants not to apply correctly when toggling themes via class. I‚Äôm considering how `ThemeProvider` interacts with the `html` element and whether header and main use static colors instead of CSS variables, which could explain why only sections reflect dark mode styling. I'll search for the `tailwind.config` file next to check the configuration.

payload.text:
**Modifying layout.tsx for theme fixes**

I'll edit layout.tsx to import the utility `cn` for cleaner class combining, adjust the body to use it, and update header, main, and footer classes to use CSS variable-based colors like `bg-background` and `border-border` so theme toggling works smoothly. I'm focusing on replacing static colors with CSS variables and refining some class structures to ensure consistent theming across the layout.

payload.text:
**Summarizing changes and next steps**

I‚Äôm preparing a final summary highlighting the import of `cn`, replacing classes with theme tokens for consistent dark mode in body, header, footer, and updating the `ThemeToggle` container for theme colors, referencing `app/web/gapyear/app/layout.tsx` with line numbers. I‚Äôll suggest running the dev server to verify without actually running tests or lint to keep within instructions, presenting modifications and next steps clearly in bullet points.

payload.message:
Dark-mode backgrounds now rely on the shared CSS variables in the root layout, so the header, main layout wrapper, and footer switch with the theme (`app/web/gapyear/app/layout.tsx:31-54`). I also pulled in `cn` to tidy the font classes and updated the toggle button‚Äôs border/hover colors to use the same theme tokens (`app/web/gapyear/app/layout.tsx:7,41-43`).

Next steps:
1. Run `pnpm --filter @app/web/gapyear dev` and flip the theme toggle to confirm the full layout responds as expected.

content.text:
Dark-mode backgrounds now rely on the shared CSS variables in the root layout, so the header, main layout wrapper, and footer switch with the theme (`app/web/gapyear/app/layout.tsx:31-54`). I also pulled in `cn` to tidy the font classes and updated the toggle button‚Äôs border/hover colors to use the same theme tokens (`app/web/gapyear/app/layout.tsx:7,41-43`).

Next steps:
1. Run `pnpm --filter @app/web/gapyear dev` and flip the theme toggle to confirm the full layout responds as expected.
